Helpful Links & Resources

These resources helped me plan my Via Dinarica adventure

My gear list

What gear do you need to do a Via Dinarica thru-hike? Well, that depends. I didn't spend a fortune and was absolutely happy with my choice of gear. I was also extremely thankful and surprised that nothing broke - and even my trail running shoes lasted the whole trail (they were supposed to tear after 1.000 km max). The only thing I had to resupply over and over again were socks!

I once read that if you want to travel light, don't ask yourself: "What do I need to take with me?" Instead ask yourself: "What can I leave behind?" I find this to be very wise and would encourage you to consider what you think you need, weigh your gear and then iterate on it until you're happy with the weight. I was very glad to be travelling light! And trust me, there's plenty of stores, supply opportunities and, most importantly, helpful people on the way. Not everywhere, of course, but usually within a few days of hiking or within a few hours of hitchhiking!

I hope my list may provide some guidance and orientation. Let me know if you have questions about specific items!

What I packed: My Via Dinarica gear list
